question.question-text: The word that in paragraph 1 refers to
question.explain-text: The passage states mentions a settlement house…that provided much-needed services to the poorest and neediest residents of the area. From this context, it can be determined that that refers to a settlement house. The third answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: The word time in paragraph 2 could best be replaced by
question.explain-text: The passage states that her father encouraged her education, something unusual for the time. From this context, it can be determined that time could best be replaced by period. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: Which of the sentences below expresses the essential information in the highlighted sentence in paragraph 2?

answer-list.answer-text: She wanted to go to either Harvard or Yale, but her father sent her to Smith College instead.
She preferred to get an appropriate education at Rockford Academy, but her father insisted that she have a more rigorous education.
Smith College tried to model itself after Harvard and Yale but was not as successful in doing so as Rockford Academy.
Her father did not allow her to get the education that she wanted and instead insisted on an education that he felt was better for a young lady.

question.explain-text: The highlighted sentence states that she had wanted to attend…Smith College but that her father…sent her to Rockford Academy, which was dedicated to turning out proper young ladies. This means that her father did not allow her to get the education that she wanted and instead insisted on an education that he felt was better for a young lady. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

insert-text.b: She suffered from physical problems such as intense backaches, headaches, and general malaise as well as experiencing feelings of depression and melancholy.

question.explain-text: The seventh sentence in paragraph 2 states that she fell ill. A sentence stating that she suffered from physical problems…and general malaise as well as…depression and melancholy would logically follow such a sentence. The third square in paragraph 2 is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: It can be inferred from the passage that Jane's family would have preferred that she

answer-text.exp: remain in Cedarville rather than move to Chicago

answer-list.answer-text: open Hull House without help from her friend
work harder to get Hull House opened

question.explain-text: The passage mentions their hometown of Cedarville and later mentions returning home, where she was expected to take on a role as kindly maiden aunt who would assist in the upbringing of her nieces and nephews and states that in spite of strong objections from her family, Jane Addams moved to Chicago. From this, it can be inferred that Jane's family would have preferred that she remain in Cedarville rather than move to Chicago. The second answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: The word momentous in paragraph 3 is closest in meaning to
question.explain-text: The passage states that she made a momentous decision. From this context, it can be determined that momentous is closest in meaning to highly significant. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: The phrase raise enough in paragraph 5 could best be replaced by
question.explain-text: The passage states that Addams was able to raise enough...to open Hull House. From this context, it can be determined that raise enough could best be replaced by gather sufficient funds. The second answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: According to the passage, it is NOT true that Hull House

answer-list.answer-text: was opened with funds that Jane raised
was started in a stately but decaying home
grew to include a variety of programs

question.explain-text: The passage states that Hull House grew substantially, financed solely by private funds. This means that it is NOT true that Hull House was provided government support. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: The author begins paragraph 6 with the phrase in spite of all the good work accomplished at Hull House in order to

answer-list.answer-text: indicate that paragraph 6 will discuss Addams' good work

answer-text.exp: relate the ideas in paragraph 5 to those in paragraph 6

answer-list.answer-text: show that the information presented in paragraph 5 was not accurate
explain that the good accomplished at Hull House was not because of Addams

question.explain-text: Paragraph 5 describes a number of Jane Addams' accomplishments, that she was able to raise enough…to open Hull House, that programs were created to provide food and housing and medical care, and that over time, Hull House, grew substantially; paragraph 6 begins with the idea that in spite of all the good work accomplished at Hull House, Jane Addams was not always viewed as a positive influence. From this, it can be determined that the author begins paragraph 6 with the phrase in spite of all the good work accomplished at Hull House in order to relate the ideas in paragraph 5 to those in paragraph 6. The second answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: The phrase a substantive role in paragraph 6 is closest in meaning to
question.explain-text: The passage states that Jane Addams demonstrated that a woman could have a substantive role outside the home. From this context, it can be determined that a substantive role is closest in meaning to a significant function. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: Which of the following is stated in the passage about Jane Addams?

answer-list.answer-text: She was born into a needy family.
She experienced good health throughout her life.
She took a trip to Europe to spend time in the finest vacation destinations.
Some of her announced positions were not well received by the public.

question.explain-text: The passage states that she was an outspoken proponent of women's rights…, a position that was assured of arousing conflict in many parts of society and that she strongly advocated peace over war, a position that also made her unpopular. From this context, it can be determined that some of her announced positions were not well received by the public. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: The phrase vilified for in paragraph 6 is closest in meaning to
question.explain-text: The passage states that when the United States entered World War I in 1917, Addams was publicly vilified for her unpopular position against the war. From this context, it can be determined that the phrase vilified for is closest in meaning to maligned because of. The third answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.direction-text: Select the appropriate sentences from the answer choices that are key points in the discussion of the path that Jane Addams took in her efforts to improve society. THREE of the answer choices will NOT be used. This question is worth 3 points.

intro-text.b: The path that Jane Addams took in her efforts to improve society

answer.answer-text: She was instrumental in establishing and running an institution devoted to improving the lives of the needy.
answer.explain-text: The passage states that within a few months of her arrival in Chicago, Addams was able to raise enough, through her contacts with church members and members of her social class, to open Hull House and that over time, Hull House grew substantially, financed solely by private funds. From this, it can be determined that she was instrumental in establishing and running an institution devoted to improving the lives of the needy. This answer provides critical information to support the topic of the path that Jane Addams took in her efforts to improve society and is therefore one of the correct answers to this question.

answer.answer-text: She was raised quite differently from her brothers and sisters.
answer.explain-text: The passage states that her father was a successful businessman and that Jane was raised in a loving environment with all of the advantages of the position that her family held. However, the passage does NOT mention whether or not she was raised quite differently from her brothers and sisters. This answer is therefore not a correct answer to this question.

answer.answer-text: Her tireless attempts to make the public aware of her views on needed changes were sometimes controversial.
answer.explain-text: The passage states that she was an outspoken proponent of women's rights and lived a life that demonstrated that a woman could have a substantive role outside the home, a position that was assured of arousing conflict in many parts of society and that furthermore, she strongly advocated peace over war, a position that also made her unpopular. From this, it can be determined that her tireless attempts to make the public aware of her views on needed changes were sometimes controversial. This answer provides critical information to support the topic of the path that Jane Addams took in her efforts to improve society and is therefore one of the correct answers to this question.

answer.answer-text: She strongly supported the military efforts of her government during World War I.
answer.explain-text: The passage states that she strongly advocated peace over war, a position that also made her unpopular and that when the United States entered World War I in 1917, Addams was publicly vilified for her unpopular position against the war. From this, it can be determined that it is NOT true that she strongly supported the military efforts of her government during World War I. This answer is therefore not a correct answer to this question.

answer.answer-text: The place that she purchased for a settlement house had formerly been a mansion that had been allowed to deteriorate.
answer.explain-text: The passage states that Hull House, in a slum area of Chicago, was a rundown mansion that was converted to a service organization for the needy population. From this, it can be determined that it is true that the place that she purchased for a settlement house had formerly been a mansion that had been allowed to deteriorate. However, it is only a detail and not a main point. This answer is therefore not a correct answer to this question.

answer.answer-text: After graduating from college, she decided to take a different path from the one chosen for her by her family and society.
answer.explain-text: The passage states that after finishing at Rockford…she decided to travel to Europe and that after returning home, where she was expected to take on a role as kindly maiden aunt who would assist in the upbringing of her nieces and nephews, she made a momentous decision to turn her life in a different direction. From this, it can be determined that after graduating from college, she decided to take a different path from the one chosen for her by her family and society. This answer provides critical information to support the topic of the path that Jane Addams took in her efforts to improve society and is therefore one of the correct answers to this question.
